channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: GM reports 2.2% decrease in third-quarter sales, but EVs make gains
item.description: The Detroit automaker reported a 2.2% drop in third-quarter sales compared to a year earlier to 659,601 vehicles sold.

item.title: Here’s the real reason 75% of corporate AI initiatives fail
item.description: 'Adding AI to a business model of the past doesn’t lead to competitiveness—it simply solidifies old processes,' writes the author of The Humanchine.

item.title: California just took the biggest shot yet against legacy admissions
item.description: “The California Dream shouldn’t be accessible to just a lucky few,” Gov. Gavin Newsom said.

item.title: Port strike fallout: Blockbuster weight-loss drug supply for U.S. hit by East Coast trade shutdown
item.description: Booming demand for blockbuster weight-loss drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro is being tested by a ports strike hitting import hubs for Novo Nordisk and ...

item.title: US job openings rose in August, surprising economists
item.description: The Labor Department reported Tuesday that employers posted 8 million vacancies in August, up from 7.7 million in July.

item.title: This alternative ETF keeps beating an increasingly tech-stocks-dependent S&P 500
Bank of America joins growing chorus on Wall Street loving this sector to play China's stimulus
item.description: Bank of America strategist Savita Subramanian upgraded the materials sector, which looks to offer at least two catalysts to spark a rally.

item.title: Bond ETFs on rise along with tensions in Middle East

item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Intel’s struggles hit Biden’s Chips and Science Act with a gut punch
All stock-market sectors have lost ground Tuesday — except energy and utilities
Nike reports earnings after the bell. Here's what Wall Street expects
item.description: Nike is in a reset after critics say it lost sight of innovation and ceded share to competitors. Its CEO, John Donahoe, is scheduled to step down this...

item.title: Homeowners are sitting on more than $35 trillion in equity
item.description: The value of all homes owned is more than double what it was a decade ago.

item.title: Meet the 2024 MacArthur ‘genius grant’ recipients
item.description: The 22 fellows will each receive a grant of $800,000 over five years to spend however they want.

item.title: U.S. stocks drop, oil jumps as Iran reportedly launches missile attack on Israel
